intro: Melicope chapelieri var. chapelieri, commonly known as the Socotra melicope, is a flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and rocky habitats, adapting to the arid conditions of its native environment. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it a subject of interest in botanical studies. The species is also valued for its potential medicinal properties.
